Dialogue:
DM: Good evening.  
BP: Good evening. How can I assist you today?  
DM: Have you made any recent purchases?  
BP: Yes, I recently acquired a neck cooler.  
DM: What is a neck cooler?  
BP: It is a device that provides a cooling sensation when chilled and worn around the neck.  
DM: Is it similar to a special towel?  
BP: It contains a coolant pack and is made from a material used in space technology.  
DM: How much does it cost?  
BP: A neck cooler is available for purchase on Qoo10 for approximately 1000 yen.  
DM: Is it reusable?  
BP: Yes, it is reusable and best used indoors or on a balcony.  
DM: How long does it remain cool?  
BP: It stays cool for about 2 hours. For outdoor activities, consider using a cooling towel or patch.  
DM: Can it help reduce electricity costs?  
BP: Yes, it can be useful for chores or when deciding whether to use an air conditioner.  
DM: My electricity bill has been high recently.  
BP: Costs can increase by around 1000 yen.  
DM: Going out also incurs expenses.  
BP: Public facilities like libraries or shopping malls are cost-effective alternatives.  
DM: I visited a mall today, and it was crowded.  
BP: Malls can lead to additional expenses such as fuel and spontaneous purchases.  
DM: I often end up buying things I don't need.  
BP: That is common in malls.  
DM: I enjoy buying books.  
BP: Libraries are a good alternative.  
DM: Libraries are convenient but popular books are often checked out.  
BP: You can reserve books, but it may take some time before they become available.  
DM: Thank you for the information.  
BP: You're welcome.

DM: Good evening.  
BP: Good evening.  
DM: Thanks in advance.  
BP: Have you had dinner?  
DM: Not yet.  
BP: Are you hungry?  
DM: I had a late lunch, so I'm okay.  
BP: We made ratatouille with zucchini.  
DM: Summer vegetables are good.  
BP: They help prevent summer fatigue and colds.  
DM: Seasonal vegetables are delicious.  
BP: A pressure cooker makes ratatouille fast.  
DM: Does it usually take long?  
BP: Yes, it needs simmering.  
DM: I made corn rice recently.  
BP: Sounds tasty. In a rice cooker?  
DM: Yes, with fresh corn.  
BP: I'll try that.  
DM: Put the cob in too.  
BP: Just the kernels?  
DM: The broth comes from the cob.  
BP: Understood. Thanks.  
DM: What other summer vegetables are there?  
BP: Tomatoes, eggplants, okra, and bitter melons.  
DM: I like tomatoes.  
BP: Fresh or in dishes.  
DM: Fresh tomatoes are better than canned ones.  
BP: Vegetables are pricey, but worth it.  
DM: Let's watch out for summer fatigue.  
BP: Agreed. Thank you.

DM: Good evening, thank you.
BP: Thank you in advance! How can I assist you today?
DM: Do you like movies?
BP: Yes, though my theater visits have decreased, I watch them on platforms like Amazon Prime.
DM: That's nice. Do you not go to theaters much?
BP: I like theaters, but haven't had the chance. The last things I watched were live-action Aladdin, Frozen 2, and the final of Kaguya-sama.
DM: I also watched Aladdin. It was romantic.
BP: It differed from the anime but was still good. The visuals were impressive.
DM: I go to the movies often since there's a theater close by.
BP: Sounds convenient! I plan to see Tang this summer, with Ninomiya-kun and a robot.
DM: Ninomiya-kun's acting is really good.
BP: Correct. I was impressed by "My Family." I'm looking forward to this movie too.
DM: Do you have a favorite actor?
BP: Recently, I'm interested in Shun Oguri from Taiga dramas and Mikako Tabe.
DM: Both are excellent actors.
BP: I agree. I took many photos of his life-sized images at the Izu Taiga Drama Museum.
DM: Nice. What's the current Taiga drama about?
BP: It's about the Kamakura shogunate. Mr. Oguri plays Yoshitoki, the younger brother of Masako Hojo.
DM: Taiga dramas are very informative.
BP: Yes, but I watch explanation videos on YouTube to understand better.
DM: I also can't keep up when there are too many characters.
BP: This drama covers the Kamakura Shogunate and the 13 retainers, so there are many characters.
DM: YouTube explanations are useful. I might need notes to keep up.
BP: Indeed. Among the movies you've seen recently in the theater, which one was the best?
DM: Kingdom 2 and Jurassic Park were interesting.
BP: I watched Kingdom's first part and am curious about the sequel. Was it grand?
DM: Yes, it felt like a must-see in a theater. The impact was amazing.
BP: I think Kingdom-type movies are best seen in theaters.
DM: I watch action movies in theaters and everything else at home.
BP: True. Human-related work can also be managed from home. Well then, I'll end the chat for today.

DM: Hello  
CN: Hello  
DM: What time did you wake up today?  
CN: 8 o'clock.  
DM: Early riser!  
CN: Took a nap after.  
DM: Naps disrupt my night sleep.  
CN: What time did you get up today?  
DM: 10 o'clock.  
CN: Is it always that late?  
DM: Weekdays, 7. Days off, later.  
CN: Holidays do start later!  
DM: Bad weather today, didn't feel like getting up.  
CN: Woke up for garbage day.  
DM: Responsible! Forgetting is the worst.  
CN: Couldn't put out recyclables due to rain.  
DM: Very thoughtful! Some here just put out trash regardless.  
CN: I feel bad for making them collect wet cardboard.  
DM: Considerate! I need to clear my cardboard too.  
CN: Cardboard piles up quickly.  
DM: I put it off until there's a lot.  
CN: Understandable, it accumulates.  
DM: Enjoy tying up cardboard neatly.  
CN: Can't organize it nicely.  
DM: Satisfying when done right!  
CN: Tips to do it well?  
DM: Tighten firmly and frequently.  
CN: I'll try next time!  
DM: Thanks for the chat!  
CN: Thank you very much!

DM: Hello  
CN: Hello  
DM: What do you do on your days off?  
CN: I read books and do housework.  
DM: You read books?  
CN: Yes, not many though.  
DM: About one book per month?  
CN: Usually one or two.  
DM: That's great! I find it hard to have energy for reading.  
CN: Reading can be tiring.  
DM: Do you read for long periods or in short bursts?  
CN: For business books, in short bursts.  
DM: Does the genre change your reading style?  
CN: For novels, I read them all at once.  
DM: Interesting! When a story is good, it’s easy to get absorbed.  
CN: Yes, especially with horror or mystery.  
DM: Right! It's easy to forget the characters over time.  
CN: Yes, you do forget.  
DM: I usually watch Netflix on holidays.  
CN: Movies or drama?  
DM: Movies and anime.  
CN: Anything interesting recently?  
DM: A soccer anime called "Aoashi."  
CN: Sounds interesting.  
DM: You know it?  
CN: A friend mentioned it.  
DM: It's one of the best in boys' manga.  
CN: Sounds intense.  
DM: If interested, check it out!  
CN: I will.

DM: Good evening.
HJ: Good evening.
DM: It’s cooler lately.
HJ: Yes, it’s warm today.
DM: Warm during the day, indeed.
HJ: Still need the fan.
DM: Did you use a fan in summer?
HJ: Yes, along with the air conditioner.
DM: Same here, and a circulator.
HJ: What is a circulator?
DM: It helps reduce electricity bills.
HJ: Did it work well?
DM: Saved about 1000 yen.
HJ: Is it pricey?
DM: Mine was 3,000 yen.
HJ: Does it really help?
DM: Yes, it improves AC efficiency.
HJ: Is your room big?
DM: About 9 tatami mats.
HJ: It still makes a difference?
DM: Yes, some days no AC needed.
HJ: Better not to turn the AC on and off too much.
DM: Yes, for short outings.
HJ: I haven’t seen this summer’s bill yet.
DM: That’s concerning.
HJ: Yes, used the AC a lot.
DM: Without AC, it’s unbearable.
HJ: Absolutely, always had it on.
DM: I didn’t even open the window.
HJ: Exactly.

DM: Hello!  
HJ: Hello.  
DM: Any summer memories?  
HJ: I went on a trip.  
DM: Where to?  
HJ: Shikoku and Ishikawa.  
DM: I haven't been there.  
HJ: Do you travel often?  
DM: Mostly nearby places.  
HJ: Did you go anywhere this summer?  
DM: Atami.  
HJ: The sea?  
DM: Yes, and food.  
HJ: Local specialties?  
DM: Salted fish and dried fish.  
HJ: Snacks with alcohol.  
DM: Yes, I drank too much.  
HJ: Bar?  
DM: Seafood bar.  
HJ: Popular?  
DM: Yes, many people. Seafood bowl was good.  
HJ: Sounds good.  
DM: Too many highballs.  
HJ: Highballs?  
DM: Yes, not straight.  
HJ: Coke highballs?  
DM: Clever idea.  
HJ: Easy to drink.  
DM: I drink too much.  
HJ: Understood.

DM: Hello!
HJ: Hello.
DM: What do you do on your days off?
HJ: I go to the hot springs.
DM: Nearby?
HJ: Yes, a big one.
DM: Jealous.
HJ: There is a waterfall.
DM: Amazing.
HJ: And many saunas.
DM: Crowded?
HJ: On holidays, yes.
DM: I often go to public baths.
HJ: Nearby?
DM: About 1 kilometer.
HJ: Do you like saunas?
DM: Recently hooked.
HJ: It's popular lately.
DM: There’s a boom. Always crowded.
HJ: Saunas are often crowded.
DM: Is it okay during COVID-19?
HJ: We're already in the same bath...
DM: Strange it’s not a cluster. Do you go often?
HJ: Not for long.
DM: My limit is 10 minutes.
HJ: 10 minutes is a lot! Maybe 5 for me.
DM: Temperature might be low. Good metabolism?
HJ: I get dizzy quickly.
DM: A friend collapsed from overexertion, be careful.
HJ: Scary! I will.
